Add proguard support

This shrinks the release apk in half.

Remove unwanted language rules files from commons-codec.

This reduces the release apk by a further 120k. The command to reproduce is
zip -d iCalImportExport/libs/commons-codec-1.10.jar 'org/apache/commons/codec/language/bm/*.txt'
from the project root directory.
Prefer match_parent to fill_parent

Add settings for reminders and reorganise settings a bit

This means you now dont need to re-enter reminders for every import or
calculate minutes per day/week in your head, and the previous behaviour
of popping up the same dialog in a loop before importing can be removed.

Update license menu

Initial refactoring of the main view.

Simplify the layout with the intention to further reduce interaction elements
(buttons and dialogs in particular) shortly. Also remember our previous export
file name a-la the import URL.

Refactor help

Move help to resources and re-write to simplify the instructions somewhat. Get rid of the
global constants file since none of them are used globally.

Also refactor things a bit so that the code to load AndroidCalendars lives in
one place only, and add a couple more fields to it.

UI updates for usability.

the number of items to insert/delete on the buttons instead of a text label.
Hide the insert/delete buttons after they are clicked and when a new file is
chosen for loading.

Add a setting to control storage of passwords.

Since preference storage files are not encrypted on Android we should allow
the user to opt-out of/make the user opt-in to storing their passwords there.

Rewrite import code to fix multiple issues

This new version is simpler than the old wrappers. It supports almost all of
the properties that can be saved. Support for importing alarms is almost
complete. All day and recurring events are properly supported as are
availability, organiser etc. This should fix github issues 1, 3, 14 and 15.

Event deletion is disabled temporarily since it needs refactoring that would
conflict with these changes. Also the behaviour of Timezones under the new
code needs investigation.
add test calendar for cases where no end date or duration are given
Reinstate event deletion
Move InsertVEvents up into ProcessVEvent
Minor cleanups following refactoring

Fix overriding TRANSP and computing DTEND from DURATION

Also simplify the test cases for this event and add more to cover
non-recurring events.
Add support for importing alarms
Remove old calendar dump files
Minor cleanups, unused code removal and formatting consistency

Use Toasts to show imported/deleted/exported results

This removes the need for the user to interact with a dialog, continuing the
work to reduce user interaction.

UI firms up.

Disable proguard for debug builds, enable debugging for all builds

There now are some annoying warnings in the debug build following this
change, but being able to debug is more important. Rebuilding the 3rd
party lib with a newer compiler will fix them and so might be worth
doing at some point.
Fix a misplaced brace

Generalise all day and repeating event code

Fixes a couple of issues with calendars seen in the wild, e.g. repeating
events where an end time is given and not a duration, and all day events.
Minor tweak to README.md
Fix progress text when deleting entries
Remove a duplicated deprecation warning

Support UIDs for event identification/duplicate detection

There is an option to keep the old behaviour of matching on start time
and title, but we default to using UIDs where present since this is
much more reliable and works across calendars without risk of deleting
events it shouldn't.
Ignore recurrence events until proper support for them is added

Generate UIDs on event insertion

Also minor refactor of query code.

Shorten UIDs slightly

This is so ical4j outputs them on one line instead of breaking them,
which helps with readability when checking them and using shell tools
to manipulate them.

Rebuild backport-util-concurrent-3.1.jar to remove warnings

From the sources of the Java 1.4 version, build with target = 1.6. This
removes the pages of warnings previously generated during debug builds.

Initial rewrite of calendar export

This fixes several issues including unique UIDs, re-using the timestamp, many
missing properties, including used timezones, non date-time dates, etc, etc.
As with the import rewrite, the code is now much simpler.

Further export changes

We now output most properties. Also fixes the zero-time duration in order
to match what Android returns.

Move CredentialInputAdapter into MainActivity and make it private

This also fixes a thinko with ftps URLs where the protocal length
wasn't taken into account properly.
Remove unused imports

Get rid of SpinnerTools

Simplify the logic somewhat as the input lists can't be null as previously
assumed, and we can enable the buttons in the spinner setup rather than
having two consecutive bits of code run against the UI thread.

Further Spinner simplificaction

Use the calendar list directly instead of mapping it to and from a
list of strings, since we already have array adapter code that does
this for free.
Return immediately once a calendar is selected
Minor code cleanup in MainActivity

Use projection columns to do less work when reading from the DB

This is e.g. around 25% faster for reading events from large calendars.
Various checkstyle fixes

Update resources

Get rid of the hungarian notation style naming and name the strings by their
content instead - this makes the code read much more naturally. Move the
settings strings out to their own file as the settings dialog and associated
resource text will eventually be auto-generated.
More resource updates

Initial cleanup of RunnableWithProgress

e.g. It doesn't make sense to have a setProgressDialog() method when the
progress dialog must be passed to run() as well. Take it in the ctor instead.
Also get rid of DialogTools.process() since all instances are called from the
controller.

Phase 2 RunnableWithProgress cleanup

Now move the progress dialog handling and task starting completely inside
RunnableWithProgress and make most of its interface private as a result.
Fix last minute typo

Use a custom dialog for entering source URLs

The previous method of using 3 consecutive dialogs for url, user and
password was highly unintuitive, e.g. Cancel meant different things in
each dialog ('cancel the action', 'proceed without using auth', and 'use
auth but leave password blank' respectively). It also presented too many
interaction elements to the user and didnt cope well with typos.

Instead of this, use a single dialog which makes it more clear/explicit
when we want to supply authentication information.
Minor cleanup to styles.xml
Rename variable to follow coding style
Implement most cleanups suggested by Android Studio
Update versionCode/versionName
More minor fixes and cleanups

Move CalendarContract to CalendarContractWrapper

It seems otherwise that the class is unused and/or stripped out,
possibly by proguard. In any case it seems more explicit.
Update CalendarContractWrapper for better backwards compatibility

Initial checkin of auto-generated settings

Settings code/resources etc is now generated from the documentation source
Resources/ical_settings.asciidoc. As part of this change the static
preferences in MainActivity are replaced by a generated non-static Settings
class.

The tool used to generate these files is prefgen.py which will be released
shortly. The command to generate the output files is the rather verbose:

export MAIN=iCalImportExport/src/main/
export SRC=${MAIN}java/org/sufficientlysecure/ical/

prefgen.py --package_name org.sufficientlysecure.ical,org.sufficientlysecure.ical.ui --layout_file ${MAIN}res/xml/settings.xml --resource_file ${MAIN}res/values/settings.xml --settings_file ${SRC}Settings.java --activity_file ${SRC}ui/SettingsActivityBase.java Resources/ical_settings.asciidoc

Still to do are adding more documentation for the settings and adding some new settings.

Add a config file for generating settings

Settings can now be generated using:

prefgen.py @Resources/ical_settings.config

prefgen is available at https://github.com/jgriffiths/prefgen.
Update to latest prefgen, use it for internal preferences
More settings documentation
Remove accidental checkin of generated asciidoc html.
Use generated settings class for all key value and to set preferences
make members reflect option method names
prefgen update, use key constants
Fix reminders settings dialog for new prefs

Implement tri-state duplicate handling

These are 1) replace duplicates with the imported version 2) Ignore
duplicates when found and 3) Don't even check.

If you enable 1) (which is now the default) then you can repeatedly import
an external calendar to pick up its changes and have your entries updated
to pick up changes, without any dupes being created.  A logical further step
at some point would be to allow these settings to be grouped with a source
and then scheduled for regular imports/exports/.
Get rid of DialogTools.ask()

Various consistency and formatting changes

Most notably, try to use the same variable names for the same types,
and remove unneeded braces from single statement ifs. This makes the
code read more consistently.
Add a missing cursor close() call
Remove unuse import

Fix duplicate handling for Issue #23

Add an option for UID's to be global across all calendars, defaulting to off.
Add another duplicate handling option to replace duplicate events in the
calendar they came from (this is not the default).

Although UIDs are meant to be globally unique, it can be counter-intuitive
to have events in other calendars changed without having configured the app
to do so.

This change reworks the processing code to hide some of the added complexity,
and prevents the query for duplicates being run twice. It also fixes the
id types from int to long.

Fix README b0rked by rename. Transifex config is still wrong
Be explicit about build directories in .gitignore
Various minor fixes

Try harder to recognise UTC timezones

Etc/UTC was not being recognised as a UTC timezone, it is an historic
alias. Accept any tz ending in /UTC and also ignore case when checking.
This hopefully fixes issue #22.

Replace local lib jar files with maven dependencies

Per the recipe from k3b/CalendarIcsAdapter, updated to ical4j-1.0.6.
This completes the changes required for issue #19.

Unfortunately this also means we get the build warnings and language
rule bloat that were fixed in our local copies. Someone should rebuild
mavens backport-util-concurrent-3.1 file ideally.
Issue #22 - Accept posix style UTC+/-0 as UTC synonyms also

Add a menu entry for debug logging

Not yet implemented but make it available to translators for when it is.

See discussion in issue #22.

Add dynamic summary to duplication options (via prefgen update)

Add text for dynamic boolean preferences.

This should minimise any further translation changes after initial release.

Enable debug logging option for users

We will need extended logging to debug user issues.

When enabled, verbose and debug messages are output as information messages
so they are not filtered nor is the code stripped out at runtime. In debug
builds the option has no effect.

Also information level logging was being filtered in debug builds which is
counter to the logging documentation on usage. Information messages are
now always output.
Only output expensive logging if the user setting is enabled

Move exception handling for RunnableWithProgress to a single place.

This makes the handling more consistent and we can improve it in a

Check UTC mismatches at every step of date initialisation

Always construct dates from date proprties using a deep copy

This is the final part of issue #22. The date passed into the Period
ctor for FREEBUSY periods gets changed. If thats not a deep copy them
we end up changing the property it came from (in this case, DTSTART/END).

Also actually output the FREEBUSY element which was missing.

These updates are disabled by default since they use data. We
could add a setting to only allow on wifi but this would require
a new permission.

Initial, fairly minimal support for import testing

This works by using events containing an X-TEST-NAME and then
one or more X-TEST-VALUE properties. The X-TEST-VALUE properties are
checked against the resulting ContentValues that (in non-test mode)
would be inserted into the DB.

This approach has its limitations but it allows us to start testing
the many permutations of inputs and to prevent regressions. The test
support can be incrementally improved as tests are added.
